isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - DISASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft front ( Figure 113).

figure.caption: Figure 113. Remove 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft Front

step1.para: Remove the reverse gear and spacer from the mainshaft rear ( Figure 114).

figure.caption: Figure 114. Remove Reverse Gear and Spacer From Mainshaft Rear

step1.para: From the mainshaft rear, pull the key from the mainshaft keyway ( Figure 115).

figure.caption: Figure 115. Pull Key From Mainshaft Keyway

note.para: When removing limit washers, spacers and gears, note their location on the mainshaft to facilitate reassembly. Keep the internal-splined washers and external-splined spacers with the gear from which they were removed. There is ONLY one limit washer and one spacer belonging to each gear.

step1.para: Turn the reverse gear limit washer to align its splines with those of the mainshaft and remove the washer ( Figure 116).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Remove Reverse Gear Limit Washer

step1.para: Remove the LO-Reverse speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft ( Figure 117).

figure.caption: Figure 117. Remove LO-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft

step1.para: Use a small screwdriver to turn the limit washer in the hub of LO speed gear to align its splines with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 118). Pull the LO speed gear from the rear of the mainshaft to remove the limit washer, spacer, and gear. If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear ( inset, Figure 118).

figure.caption: Figure 118. Turn Limit Washer to Align Splines With Mainshaft Splines, and Remove Snap Ring From I.D. of Gear

step1.para: Remove each remaining gear, limit washer, spacer, and sliding clutch from the mainshaft in the same manner previously detailed ( Figure 119). And, if necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of each gear.

figure.caption: Figure 119. Remove Each Remaining Gear, Limit Washer, Spacer, and Sliding Clutch
